intro: Fleischmannia jejuna, commonly known as the slender fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its sparsely branched stems and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent stems and reduced leaves. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
